span.a: County Facilities Closed to Public Read On...

p.span: - Increase your productivity, customize your experience, and engage in information you care about.

h4.a: Tax Commissioner’s Office Opening to Public on May 7, 2020 for Title Transfers Only

div.div: The Lumpkin County Tax Commissioner’s Office will reopen for limited in-person visits on Thursday, May 7, 2020. Read on...
If you have a fever, cough, or shortness of breath, call your local health department about testing. Read on...

h4.a: Yahoola Creek Park and Lake Zwerner Reservoir Trail to Reopen to Local Residents

div.div: Effective Thursday, April 23 at 7:00 a.m., both Yahoola Creek Park and the Lake Zwerner Reservoir Trail will reopen for use by local residents. Please read on for a full list of guidelines. Read on...

h4.a: Governor Kemp's Latest Order Regarding Reopening Georgia's Economy

div.div: During Governor Kemp’s press conference yesterday, he announced steps he is authorizing to begin to reopen Georgia’s economy. Read on...
ACCG has provided a document that provides further guidance on the governor's shelter in place order. Read on...
An executive order issuing a statewide shelter in place to stop the spread of COVID-19 was signed by Governor Kemp yesterday. Read on...

h4.a: Statewide General Primary/Presidential Preference Primary postponed until June 9

div.div: Today, Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger announced that pursuant to the authority vested in him by O.C.G.A. § 21-2-50.1, he is postponing the Statewide General Primary/Presidential Preference Primary Election until June 9, 2020. Read on...

h4.a: Executive Order to Suspend Short-Term Rentals

div.div: Governor Kemp has issued an Executive Order to suspend short-term rentals in Georgia beginning at 12:00 am on Thursday, April 9, 2020, and extending twenty-one (21) days until Thursday, April 31, 2020. Read on...

h4.a: Georgia's State of Emergency Extended to May 13, 2020

div.div: Today Governor Brian P. Kemp, Lieutenant Governor Geoff Duncan, and House Speaker David Ralston announced plans to extend Georgia’s public health state of emergency through May 13, 2020, to mitigate the spread of COVID-19. Read on...

h4.a: Detour at Stone Pile Gap Roundabout Project begins April 7th

div.div: The Georgia Department of Transportation (GDOT) reports that their construction partners will implement a 90-day detour off Stone Pile Gap Road in order to continue working on the SR 9/SR 60/Stone Pile Gap Road roundabout project. T Read on...

h4.a: Webinars Offered for Small Businesses on Coronavirus Relief Funding

div.div: Earlier this week, Congress passed the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act, a $2.2 trillion stimulus package. Read on...

h4.a: Economic Impact Payments Coming from the US Treasury

div.div: The U.S. Department of Treasury will provide information about the economic impact payments under the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act (CARES Act). Read on...

Apple Inc., in partnership with the White House Coronavirus Task Force, has released an app and website to help guide Americans through a series of questions in order to determine if they should seek care for COVID-19 symptoms. Read on...

h4.a: Northeast Georgia Health Systems Shares Information with our Community

div.div: Northeast Georgia Health Systems is still urging everyone to help slow the spread of COVID-19 by staying home as much as possible, maintaining distance from others and washing hands regularly. Read on...
Information regarding a State of Emergency Declaration and a resolution encouraging the adherence to CDC guidelines on COVID-19 and any amendments are in this post. Read on...

h4.a: Chattahoochee-Oconee National Forests temporarily shuts down trailheads, access points

div.div: The Chattahoochee-Oconee National Forests is temporarily shutting down trailhead facilities and other access points to the Appalachian National Scenic Trail and nearby trails to prevent groups from congregating and to protect public health and safety. Read on...

h4.a: Motor Vehicle Deadlines Extended in Response to COVID-19

div.div: Due to concerns regarding COVID-19, the Georgia Motor Vehicle Division (MVD) is extending all motor vehicle registrations that expire between March 16, 2020, and May 14, 2020. Read on...
Many utility providers are postponing disconnection services amind COVID-19. Read on...

h4.a: Absentee Ballot Request Forms Are Being Mailed to Every Georgia Voter

div.div: The Georgia Secretary of State’s Office announces absentee ballot request forms will be sent to every Georgia voter. Read on...
Attached for your review are the Executive Orders issued yesterday by Governor Brian Kemp. Read on...
There are now confirmed cases of Lumpkin County citizens that have COVID-19. Read on...
Governor Kemp has issues an executive order regarding the Home Building Industry. Read on...

h4.a: Help for Small Businesses Suffering as a Result of Coronavirus

div.div: The U.S. Small Business Administration (SBA) has designated all counties in Georgia eligible for low-interest federal disaster loans for working capital to small businesses suffering substantial economic injury as a result of the Coronavirus (COVID-19). Read on...
We know everyone is getting Coronavirus Fatigue (not a real diagnosis, we just made that up!), but this information is so important that it’s worth being reminded of over and over. Read on...

h4.a: Lumpkin County Parks & Recreation Programs Suspended

div.div: Effective Monday, March 16, in conjunction with the Lumpkin County School System and to help prevent possible COVID-19 exposures, all Lumpkin County Parks & Rec programs will be suspended until further notice. Read on...
The following information is being provided as a community service. Read on...

The Georgia Department of Public Health (DPH) says that the same measures that are urged to prevent the spread of any respiratory virus are recommended for preventing the spread of Coronavirus/COVID-19. Read on...
Lumpkin County is communicating daily with our state and community partners and have emergency procedures in place to address the issues related to this unique virus. Read on...
As concerns over Coronavirus continue to grow nationally and in our region, Northeast Georgia Physicians Group's medical director has created a fact sheet on the virus. Read on...
For more information on the Reservoir Master Planning Project, you can visit the Development Authority's website. Read on...

h4.a: Georgia EPD Eases Level 1 Drought Response

div.div: As a result of recent rainfall, the Georgia EPD has ended its Level 1 Drought Response some Georgia Counties. Read on...
The Lumpkin County Senior Center has an urgent need for Meals on Wheels Volunteers. Read on...

Lumpkin County has partnered with CivicReady to provide an automated mass notification system for its citizens. CivicReady is a communication service that sends immediate alerts to Lumpkin County’s citizens who are subscribed to the system. Read on...

h4.a: Secure Rural Schools Act - Notice of Use of Funds

div.div: In accordance with Federal law, Lumpkin County does hereby publish the notice of the use of SRS funds. Read on...
A community that works together to continuously improve the health and quality of life for all individuals and families in Lumpkin County is the vision of Lumpkin Matters. Read on...
In an effort the keep our county litter free, we offer a form that can be used to request litter removal. Read on...
With the launch of the new MyAccount feature, visitors to our website can now customize their viewing experience! Read on...
/CivicAlerts.aspx
